titleInfo.title: Letter, Henry Cherry in Memphis, Tenn. to Amos Gould in Owosso, Mich., 1865 November 1

mods.abstract: In this letter, dated November 1, 1865, from Henry Cherry in Memphis, Tenn. to Amos Gould, Cherry expresses happiness over rumors that they are to be mustered out today. Describes Jackson as "a wealthy & very beautiful place said to be the handsomest town in Tennessee. But the people are very different from those of E. Tennessee. They are proud, haughty, aristocratic, and are today as rebellious in spirit as they were four years ago." Also talks of post-war anger in both Jackson and Memphis.

subject.topic: United States. Army. Michigan Cavalry Regiment, 10th (1861-1865).

recordInfo.recordOrigin: This MODS record was generated into MODS v3.5 from the TEI teiHeader by University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives, using a stylesheet available at https://github.com/utkdigitalinitiatives/tei-to-mods.
